definition[0]: to throw away or destroy something you do not want anymore
example[0]: It’s time we got rid of all these old toys.
example[1]: Governments should be encouraged to get rid of all nuclear weapons.
definition[1]: to take action so that you no longer have something unpleasant that you do not want
example[2]: I can’t get rid of this cough.
example[3]: He opened the windows to get rid of the smell.
definition[2]: to make someone leave because you do not like them or because they are causing problems
example[4]: Are you trying to get rid of me?
example[5]: It can be difficult for schools to get rid of poor teachers.
